title.native: ロザリオとバンパイア

description: By a bizzare coincidence, Tsukune Aono has accidentally gotten himself admitted to a youkai academy, a school attended by monsters. Just when he thinks he'll run away from there, he meets the beautiful girl Moka and his mood turns ultra happy. However, she transforms into her true form when the rosary on her chest is taken off, she's a super vampire!

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Succubus
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a succubus, a creature in medieval folklore that typically uses their sexual prowess to trap and seduce people to feed off them.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Mermaid
tags.description: A mythological creature with the body of a human and the tail of a fish.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

node.description:

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

**Non-Anime Roles:**
- Irene - Arknights (VG)
- Unknown God - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Kiana Kaslana - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
- Luna - Punishing: Gray Raven (VG)

__Height:__ 153 cm 

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/NM_NANAPARTY) | [Website](https://www.mizukinana.jp/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/mizukinanaKING) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/nanamizuki_nm7)

She is admired by many of her fellow actors and fans because of the fact that she has a great amount of power and strength in her singing voice, which surprises many fans due to her regularly petite stature. She was also the winner of the "Best Musical Performance" award in the first Seiyuu Awards. She was also part of the quartet Prits alongside Yumiko Kobayashi, Natsuko Kuwatani, and Hisayo Mochizuki (all four voiced characters in the anime _Sister Princess_). Her singing style comes from singing Enka since she was young.

In July 2020, she married someone from the music industry, and they had their first child on March 16, 2021.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Ittasha in Bakuage Sentai Boonboomger

__Height:__ 153 cm 

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/NM_NANAPARTY) | [Website](https://www.mizukinana.jp/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/mizukinanaKING) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/nanamizuki_nm7)

She is admired by many of her fellow actors and fans because of the fact that she has a great amount of power and strength in her singing voice, which surprises many fans due to her regularly petite stature. She was also the winner of the "Best Musical Performance" award in the first Seiyuu Awards. She was also part of the quartet Prits alongside Yumiko Kobayashi, Natsuko Kuwatani, and Hisayo Mochizuki (all four voiced characters in the anime _Sister Princess_). Her singing style comes from singing Enka since she was young.

In July 2020, she married someone from the music industry, and they had their first child on March 16, 2021.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Ittasha in Bakuage Sentai Boonboomger

Saeko Chiba took up ballet at a young age with ambitions of becoming part of Takarazuka Revue. However, having failed the entrance exam for Takarazuka Music School in her third year of middle-school she joined the Minami Aoyama Shōjo Kageki Dan (南青山少女歌劇団, also called Nanshō for short) a stage group for teenage girls. Having had several lead roles over the three years she spent with the troupe, Saeko was then cast in the lead voice acting role of Kotori Haruno in the Sega Dreamcast game Diamond Daydreams. Having had a taste of being a seiyū and deciding that she preferred voice acting to performing on stage, Saeko decided to pursue the career full-time.

Saeko has also pursued a singing career with [Yuki Kajiura](https://anilist.co/staff/100077), who wrote music for some of the Nanshō stage shows, writing and producing almost all her material. Her first single was Koi no Kiseki, the theme song for the PlayStation game Meguri Aishite. She has since released nine singles and two albums, along with various character song and drama CDs. She has also performed theme songs for games such as Alundra 2 and Atelier Judie.

Saeko was also part of the group tiaraway with fellow Nanshō member [Yuuka Nanri](https://anilist.co/staff/95366). The duo released three singles and an album before breaking up on March 6 2005.

On August 26th, 2007 she married (on her 30th birthday), and on February 17, 2011 she gave birth to her first child, a daughter.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/koyamakimiko)

[Profile (StarCrew)](https://www.starcrew.co.jp/talent/misatofukuen/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/misa0110) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/misato_fukuen/)

**Non-Anime Roles**:
• Sushang (Honkai Series)
• Hopper1 (Kamen Rider Gotchard)
• Eupha (Metaphor: ReFantazio)
• Natsume Iroha (Blue Archive)

He's been a huge fan of vampires and monsters since he was a little kid. He says one of the perks of being a manga artist is being able to go for walks during the day when everybody else is stuck in the office. He was Norihiro Yagi's assistant while _Angel Densetsu_ was being published.

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

__Alma mater:__ Tokyo Designer Gakuin College (Animation Department)

Freelance animator and anime director. Married to Naoko Shiraishi, ex-Shaft/Gainax producer and founder of the animation studio Millepensee. He has a [weekly column](http://animestyle.jp/column/battari/) at Anime Style.

__Alma mater:__ Tokyo Designer Gakuin College (Animation Department)

Freelance animator and anime director. Married to Naoko Shiraishi, ex-Shaft/Gainax producer and founder of the animation studio Millepensee. He has a [weekly column](http://animestyle.jp/column/battari/) at Anime Style.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenokun)

Kouhei attended Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music (Music Faculty, Composition Department), studying under Tomojirou Ikenouchi and other professors. He worked for three consecutive years at Victor Music Industries after he graduated from the University. He attended Berklee College of Music for two years after he left Victor Music Industries. After returning to Japan, Kouhei started his activities as a composer.

Though Kouhei had been playing at the hotel at first, he was requested to compose an insert song for "Arcadia of My Youth: Endless Orbit SSX", a 1982 TV anime, and it became his first work as a composer. Afterwards, he handled some more compositions of insert songs, this time for the Super Sentai series and he also did the composition of the background music for a TV anime, Konpora Kid, in 1985.

Notably, the score for [Top wo Nerae! Gunbuster](https://anilist.co/anime/949/) made his name and talent very famous among anime fans, and is recognized as one of his most important works. He also handled the composition of [Top wo Nerae 2! Diebuster](https://anilist.co/anime/1002/) and showed a peculiar arrangement, which he added to his previous 17-year-old work. Another of his most important work is often said to be [Yuusha-Ou GaoGaiGar](https://anilist.co/anime/890/), and the [sequel](https://anilist.co/anime/1382/) following it.

In 2002, he won the first Tokyo Anime Award for Best Music for his work on [Overman King Gainer](https://anilist.co/anime/1792/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2283956552)

Originally an animator.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/takeshitakadera)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bakusyousuika) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/15355517) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsdfYXxtj5nCYIyQ7ZZLkyw)

Close friends with [Atsushi Nishigori](https://anilist.co/staff/104029/) and [Akira Amemiya](https://anilist.co/staff/100956/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanyasaki)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/931752627359977472)

Currently mainly active at [Trigger](https://anilist.co/studio/803/).

Yoshigaki joined [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) after graduating from Yoyogi Animation School. There he immediately got along with fellow animator [Hiroyuki Imaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/97349/), who joined the studio at the same time. Imaishi says that Yoshigaki is the "ideal animator."

__[Profile](http://www.ariamusic.co.jp/elements-garden/fujita/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Junpei_Fujita)__

Member of the "music production brand" Elements Garden.

__[Profile](http://www.ariamusic.co.jp/elements-garden/fujita/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Junpei_Fujita)__

Member of the "music production brand" Elements Garden.

A Japanese animator and designer.
